Stem: Green and striped. Covered in short hairs when young, which fall off at maturity.
Leaves: Lower leaves in groups of 3, upper leaves singular. Covered in short hairs when young. Fine, greyish.
Flowers: Pea-like white flowers with a pink streak at the base. 9-12 mm long.
FruitSeeds: Pods which are pea-like, 1.5-3 cm long, covered in short hairs. Turn black when mature and release olive-brown seeds explosively.
Habitat: Pastures, forests, plantations, riparian areas, grasslands.
DistinguishingFeatures: White flowers and fine leaves distinguish from Scotch broom (*Cytisus scoparius*).
